page.title: 18The Stretching Machine.
page.content: This machine was engineered by Smith's Engineers of Whitworth to a design of Roe Acre's specification, 7 years ago. It was based on machinery used in the USA and is{the only one of its kind {in England. } The purpose of the machine is to stabilize the cloth by taking out all the inherent stretch in the yarns, and the cloth passes backwards and forwards from one roller to the other under very great controlled tension. The operative has to be highly skilled and develop a "feel" for the fabric, so that he knows how much tension to apply. When the cloth is finished it is despatched to a rubber coater who bonds several layers of cloth with rubber to make a roll of rubber coated cloth which is used as pads when paper is being printed.
